did.unittitle: Frances Eikel Whittaker Palmer Weed papers 1912-1975 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Government employee and North Carolina resident. Collection consists primarily of correspondence to Mrs. Weed. She graduated from the University of Texas, worked as a secretary for the government, and the Texas Gulf Sulphur Company and served in the military during WWII. She settled with her second husband in Asheville, NC. Other items include legal documents, stock reports, tax statements, clippings, school report cards, church programs, pictures, photo albums, and three volumes of memorabilia from the school days of her children.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Frances Eikel Whittaker Palmer Weed Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Frances Eikel Whittaker Palmer Weed Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 1980.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession(s) described in this finding aid: 7-30-80
This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists primarily of correspondence to Mrs. Weed. She graduated from the University of Texas, worked as a secretary for the government, and the Texas Gulf Sulphur Company and served in the military during World War II. She settled with her second husband in Asheville, N.C. Other items include legal documents, stock reports, tax statements, clippings, school report cards, church programs, pictures, photo albums, and three volumes of memorabilia from the school days of her children.

did.unittitle: Frances Eikel Whittaker Palmer Weed Papers, 1912-1975 and undated

scopecontent.p: The bulk of the correspondence in Box 1 ranges from 1960 to 1961. Miscellaneous folder in Box 2 contains grades, event programs, and writings by others. Yearbook in Box 3 is The Cricket from Seguin High School. Poem notebook in Box 3 is that of Josie Whittaker and contains both original poems and copies of others.
